Package com.amonson.node_monitoring

Class NodeMonitoringFactory

java.lang.Object
com.amonson.node_monitoring.NodeMonitoringFactory
public class NodeMonitoringFactory extends Object
Factory to create a message-based (network) node monitoring class using a heartbeat. The implementation independent configuration properties are: NodeExpirationTime - (def. 4000ms) After a node has no heartbeat for this time in ms, the node is marked as missing. NodeAlivePeriod - (def. 1900ms) This is the period of the heartbeat sent out by this node. ThreadsPoolCount - (def. 3) This is the number of threads in the pool used by user callbacks. See the implementation class documentation for specific implementation specific configuration. Current implementations are: "zeromq" - A JeroMQ-based implementation.

  • Method Details

    • createSingletonInstance

      public static NodeMonitoring createSingletonInstance(String implementation, String myHostname, List<String> allHostnames, int port, NodeStateChangeHandler nodeStateChangeHandler, org.apache.logging.log4j.core.Logger logger, Properties config)
      Create or get the specific implementation. There can only be one per process and only one per host using the port and port + 1 network ports.
      Parameters:
      implementation - The implementation to create, if a subsequent call in a process attempts a new implementation it will only receive the original implementation.
      myHostname - This needs to be the network resolvable hostname of this node.
      allHostnames - This is a list of all hostnames in the cluster. It may contain "myHostname". All names must be network resolvable. This may be null denoting a cluster of only this node.
      port - The base port used for node to node communication. The next numeric port (port + 1) is used for another process on the same node to communicate with this class use a REQ socket for this. Privileged ports are not allowed (ports < 1024) .
      nodeStateChangeHandler - The callback which is called when a node becomes alive or is deemed missing.
      logger - The logger used for logging in this class.
      config - The configuration properties for the created instance.
      Returns:
      The newly created instance or the previously created instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any required arguments passed are null. These are: "myHostname" and "logger".

    • createClient

      public static NodeMonitoringClient createClient(String implementation, String myHostname, List<String> allHostnames, int port, org.apache.logging.log4j.core.Logger logger)
      Based on the implementation name for the NodeMonitoring cluster implementation, you can use the same name to create a standalone client to send messages to localhost at port+1 to the cluster. In other words specify the same port and implementation name in both server and client side and the client will talk to the server at localhost.
      Parameters:
      implementation - The implementation to create, which must use the same implementation name as the NodeMonitoring implementation.
      myHostname - This needs to be the network resolvable hostname of this node.
      allHostnames - This is a list of all hostnames in the cluster. It may contain "myHostname". All names must be network resolvable. This may be null denoting a cluster of only this node.
      port - The base port used for node to node communication. The next numeric port (port+1) is used for another process using the NodeMonitoringClient on the same node to communicate with the server. Privileged ports are not allowed (ports < 1024) .
      logger - The logger used for logging in this class.
      Returns:
      The newly created instance of the NodeMonitoringClient to talk to the NodeMonitoring cluster but only on a node with the server running.
